entry.title: How Pablo made creating social media posts easy

link.title: How Pablo made creating social media posts easy

entry.content:
Do you create image posts for social media?

Well, we have all heard social media experts emphasizing the importance of images to gain impressions/views in social media. 
However, creating an image post is quite cumbersome in Photoshop. Frankly, it just takes too much time.

One day I discovered Canva. Creating image posts became simple. Layering, filters, cropping etc. along with predefined templates; What more can you ask for?

Life was good, till I met Pablo. BAM! Simple became easy.

The above image post was made using Pablo.

  1. Selecting canvas size: You can select a canvas for Pinterest, Instagram, Facebook or Twitter. Each platform has its own dimension rules for images; This is taken care by Pablo.
  2. Selecting a background: I normally select free stock Photos from Unsplash ; High resolution photos that are free to use. Pablo uses Unsplash by default to set background images.
  3. Writing the text: The text section is divided into header, body and caption. It also generates random inspirational quotes for you.
  4. Setting your logo: Upload your logo once and forget about it. You have the option to hide it, change the size and add radius to make it rounded.
  5. Sharing the post: One click share to Twitter, Facebook, Pinterest and Instagram; You can also download or buffer the post.

Even writing the text can be eliminated by using the Pablo extension for Chrome .

"Art is the elimination of the unnecessary." Pablo Picasso

Still can’t believe it’s that simple. Give it a try : Pablo .
I bet you won’t regret it.
